title: What Does SS Mean? Snapchat, Texting, and More

steps.title: SS typically stands for â€œscreenshot.â€
steps.content: SS typically stands for â€œscreenshot.â€ Pretty much any phone, tablet, or computer can capture a still image, or screenshot, of the screen. This feature is widely used on sites like Snapchat, where screenshotting happens pretty frequently. So, if you see â€œSSâ€ in a text or social media setting, itâ€™s pretty safe to assume that it stands for â€œscreenshot.â€ [1] X Research source â€œSS this gif to see what TV show you should watchâ€ â€œSS this and send it your friendsâ€ â€œPlease donâ€™t SS thisâ€ SS can be spelled with all capital letters or with all lowercase letters (ss).

steps.content: SS usually means â€œscreenshotâ€ over text and other chatting platforms. Snapchat is probably the most likely place where youâ€™ll see SS used regularly, but itâ€™s also fair game on over text and other social media apps. steps.content: SS can occasionally mean â€œspeak soon.â€ â€œScreenshotâ€ is definitely the most popular definition of SS, but itâ€™s not the only one. In certain contexts, SS can mean â€œspeak soonâ€ when sent over text. â€œHavenâ€™t heard from you in a long time. We should ss!â€

steps.title: Ask someone to screenshot something.
steps.content: Ask someone to screenshot something. Want your followers to screenshot something from your Snapchat or Instagram story? Need your friend to send you all the juicy details from a text convo with their co-worker? SS is a great way to get the message across clearly and quickly. [3] X Research source â€œSS my Story for a fun surpriseâ€ â€œPlease send me a SS of that lmaoâ€ Snapchat notifies you when someone screenshots your chats, so you can also use SS to comment on how someone took a picture of your chat. â€œIâ€™m so confused. Lucy just took a SS of our chat??â€

steps.title: Let a friend know that youâ€™d like to chat with them soon.
steps.content: Let a friend know that youâ€™d like to chat with them soon. Reconnecting with an old friend or acquaintance is always tricky, but a quick SS is a simple way to get the conversation going on any chat platform. â€œMiss you so much! We should ssâ€ â€œAre you free this weekend? We need to ssâ€

steps.title: SS can stand for â€œSchutzstaffel,â€ a military group from Nazi Germany.
steps.content: SS can stand for â€œSchutzstaffel,â€ a military group from Nazi Germany. One of SSâ€™s most infamous namesakes, the Schutzstaffel, was a group of Nazi German soldiers that served under Adolf Hitler and his regime. Throughout Hitlerâ€™s reign and WWII, the SS was responsible for countless atrocities, including the Nazi concentration camps. [4] X Research source If youâ€™re chatting with someone about world history, thereâ€™s a chance that SS could refer to this military group. â€œJust started a new historical documentary about the SS, and Iâ€™m honestly horrifiedâ€

steps.content: SS can also stand for â€œSocial Securityâ€ in America. SS is often seen in the acronym â€œSSN,â€ which stands for Social Security Number. [5] X Research source Person 1: â€œI think I lost my SS card ğŸ’€â€ Person 2: â€œThatâ€™s not goodâ€¦â€ â€œThey asked me for my SSN so I hung up on them LOLâ€

steps.title: SS sometimes means â€œsteamship.â€
steps.content: SS sometimes means â€œsteamship.â€ In British English, â€œSSâ€ is commonly paired with ship names that arenâ€™t a part of any naval fleet. steps.title: SS is short for â€œsaintsâ€ in religious settings.
steps.content: SS is short for â€œsaintsâ€ in religious settings. Some churches with multiple saints in their name use SS to abbreviate their official title. [7] X Research source If someone brings up the church they go to, SS could be used in that context. â€œI go to the church of SS Luke and Matthew.â€

steps.title: SS stands for the Latin word scilicet on legal documents.
steps.content: SS stands for the Latin word scilicet on legal documents. If youâ€™ve ever gotten a document notarized before, you might have noticed a cursive â€œS.S.â€ on the paper. It literally translates to â€œnamelyâ€ or â€œin particular,â€ and is found next to the venue element on the document, like the county. Typically, â€œS.S.â€ means that the notary needs to be more specific about a certain part of the form. [8] X Trustworthy Source American Society of Notaries Non-profit organization providing education, training, and supplies to notaries in the United States. Go to source If you saw â€œS.S. (town/city)â€ marked next to a â€œcounty of ___â€ form on a document, the notary might need to include the county as well as the town and city name. In some cases, SS is just there for show, and the notary doesnâ€™t actually have to do anything.

steps.title: SS can refer to the â€œshortstopâ€ position in baseball.
steps.content: SS can refer to the â€œshortstopâ€ position in baseball. Striking up a conversation with a baseball fan? They might use abbreviations like â€œSS,â€ which just refers to the shortstop position on a baseball team (the player who stands in between second and third base). [9] X Research source â€œHow do you feel about the SS for the Giants?â€ â€œThink the Yankees will trade for a new SS?â€
